page.title: 06Industry in Rogate
page.content: One of the more unusual industry in our area is a small brewery which was started up about five years ago by a married couple in some farm buildings. This year they have bought their first public house at Elsted. Their assistant earns about Â£400 a month making the three and a half brews a week. There is one other worker besides the boss who drives the beer out to the 44 public houses which buy it. Called Ballards Beer it has a slightly bitter flavour but the worker liked it for he drinks a pint a day. As he has worked there for several years he no longer notices the strong smell or worries when it spills on the floor which was once the cow shed and still has a dung channel.
